data: ETAP was the first vocational school in Portugal, having opened its doors in the municipality of Pombal in 1989; It has as its vision "To establish ETAP as a national reference in vocational education and training, distinguished by quality professionals, its students, trained and placed on the labor market, by its ethical and socially responsible approach and for being a professional fulfillment space of its employees" and having as Mission "to contribute to the training of young people and adults of the region, working in proximity and partnership with economic agents to better meet their needs and desires and seeking to contribute to the professional and personal development of its students and employees, and to improve the competitiveness of companies and therefore to improve the economic situation of the region and the country”.European activities will involve the mobility of secondary vocational education, and are:• Internships in hosting companies (92 days / France and the UK) • 6 students of the 12th year and 6 recent graduates of Industrial Maintenance courses, Mechatronics Automotive & Electromechanical, Tourism, Metalworking production • Programming and Machining (CNC) Sales, Polymers Processing, Health Assistant• Training action and observation of work context (13 days / Germany) • 27 students of the 11th year of the Industrial Maintenance course (this activity requires two accompanying teachers)• Job Shadowing Activity (5 days / Denmark and Poland) 6 teachers of socio-cultural departments, scientific, mechanical, mechatronics, health, tourism.Specific objectives for students and recent graduates:• Provide a first experience in an international context• Motivate to learn technical competences to the training curriculum• Facilitate the transition from school world to the labour market world• Provide the integration of an European dimension in training due to the participation in a training action in an international context or by going abroad through an international working environment experience• Promote the importance and the pleasure to learn languages• Strengthen the knowledge acquired during the training for its practical applicationThe specific goals for teachers are connected with the goals for the school itself, since they are the main actors in the implementation of educational service of ETAP:• Motivate the employees in the performance of their jobs• Acquire new pedagogic skills which will then be transferred to the context of ETAP• Introduce new ways to coordinate and supervise the training programs in the work context• Establish partnerships that can generate new proposals for transnational cooperation projects• Define new strategies to promote the academic success of students• Acquire management skills in the ECVET certification processAre defined as specific impacts:1) students and recent graduates• Being motivated for continuous learning complementing, this way, the training curriculum• Facilitate the transition process from the school world to the labour market world• Being more aware of the added value of integrating a European dimension in their education• Understand the importance of learning languages• Strengthen the knowledge acquired within the training for its practical application• Acquire new personal skills in communication and management of intercultural relations2) teachers (and the functions they perform, ETAP itself)• Acquired new personal skills in interpersonal communication and intercultural• Being motivated to carry out their functions• Feel valued in their role as teachers and promoters of the academic success of the students• Acquired new teaching skills to transfer to the context of ETAP• Be able to transfer the knowledge and skills acquired to define new coordination practices and supervision of training programs in the workplace• Establish new partnerships for transnational cooperation• Be able to define new strategies to promote the academic success of students• Acquire skills to allow a good management of ECVET certification processRegarding the evaluation of the project, we can highlight some qualitative indicators: • Number of candidates interested• Lack of dropouts• Level  of success of the internships• Taking until the end the language courses available in the OLS platform• School visibility (contacts by candidates to students, companies)• Achool organization (introduction to new practices and competences)• Partnership management (maintenance of the partnerships established under the project)
JAEN+: Formación Profesional con Plus en Europa

JAÉN+: Formación Profesional con Plus en Europa is an initiative by Diputación de Jaén, that gathers 7 vocational training centres from the province of Jaén. The project aims to improve the training of 60 people facilitating their labour integration. Through an analysis of the situation of the labour market in Jaén, and the analysis of the educational system, 6 are the sectors identified as necessary to boost:- Plastic- Office management- Finances- Marketing- Electricity and electronics- ICTParticipants will be selected after a selection process, being the same one in every center- the programme will consist in:- 40 hours intercultural preparation- 3 weeks language course- 9 week work placement in international companies, to choose among Germany, Italy, Lithuania, Poland and United KingdomApart from these three main activities, participants will aslo have several workshops and work sessions about labour integration and entrepreneurship, leaded by EURES JaénThe project will be promoted and coordinated by Diputación de Jaén, though every center belonging to the consortium will take part in every phase. Diputación de Jaén is committed to make of this project something stable and sustainable, and will co-fund the project in some of its phases
TECNO RETE 4.0: nuove competenze per il trasferimento tecnologico

In 2016 the fourth industrial revolution was one of the hot topics that provoked a debate about what skills to form to meet the needs of new 4.0 companies and industries. 
The 4.0 will bring, according to some analysts, and in line with the national plan "industry 4.0", automated and interconnected production generating the need for new curricula and new career paths. In line with the need to equip the local and regional labour market of professionalism, fulfilling the needs of smart factory 4.0, a Consortium, formed by Polo Fermi-Giorgi, ISI Garfagnana, IIS Galilei-claw, ITI Ferrari, has been set to develop and implement international 4.0 WBL experiences.
Specifically, the Consortium, with the TECNO RETE 4.0 project, aims to promote personal, civic, cultural and professional growth of its students and offer training courses aimed at the acquisition of specific skills in the area of 4.0.
The project aims at sending abroad 160 students (IV year of study) with specializations in the following areas: COMPUTER SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY, ELECTRONICS and ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING, MECHANICS AND MECHATRONICS.
Among 160 students, 5 students will be selected from the ones with BES and/or disabilities.
In continuity with the alternance of “school classes and work experiences”, the aim of the project is to enrich the preparation of participants to address the demands of the local labour market and acquire independence and maturity in their personal choices. Participants ' needs are at a glance:
-to acquire/improve their technical and professional skills within international 4.0 Smart Factories
-improve their language skills and communicative skills
-improve their intercultural, socio-relational, civic skills
-make themselves more competitive and be ready to enter the local labour market at the end of the studies
The Consortium has the following objectives:
-improve their training offer-strengthen the skills of its students by offering innovative and quality paths
-strengthen the capacity of staff in terms of management, mentoring and monitoring training paths
-improve their skills in managing international mobility experiences
-improve cooperation with companies at local and international level
-better use of ECVET and EUROPASS devices and systems
As for the international project partners, the project aims to improve the quality multi-actorial networks that implement international work experiences; foster their growth as well as improving their ability to manage international placements and monitoring procedures.
From the project, the expected results are:
-for participants: more technical and professional skills in the field of specialization in order to easily enter the labour market; more linguistic and transversal skills; acquisition of certification (evidence of validations) to be used in the local and international labour market; 
-for the Consortium: better and increased educational tools and methods as well as the better training programs focusing on alternating lessons to work experiences;  shareable and transfereable instruments aimed at the validation and recognition of learning outcomes; staff able to manage European paths and also able to improve school curricula.
-international partnership: ability to use tools for monitoring, evaluation, certification of trainees' skills; better and wider international network of partnership.
The project aims to impact on local and regional education systems, improving educational offers, improve the collaboration with companies and trade associations; it is expected an impact on national and European policies going to facilitate the review of the professional figures 4.0 in different directories; the improvement of certification and recognition of skills at national and international level; an increased number of international mobility projects for both students and staff of schools and companies in order to promote "the circulation of knowledge" and active exchanges in addition to the construction of networks and synergies.
Project activities will be implemented from October 1, 2017 to September 30, 2019, for a total of 24 months. Expected mobility flows are 10 with16 participants each. 
Mobilities will be organised in the summer of 2018 and summer of 2019 according to two main work-flows. 
Each mobility flow will last 28 days + 2 for travelling in the United Kingdom, Portugal, Malta, Cyprus, Slovenia.
For each mobility flow is foreseen a teacher who will accompany and supervise the project and the students. It is foreseen an accompanying person for  every student with BES and/or disabilities to facilitate their stay.

Our consortium is formed by the city council of La Rinconada as coordinating partner and by all vocational training centers of the city as sending partners: IES San José de la Rinconada, IES Carmen Laffon, IES Miguel de Mañara, and IES Antonio Ulloa. The project is a continuation of an approved project in 2015, aiming to meet the training needs presented by local youths. The main objective is to promote student mobility in VET intermediate level of the following professional sectors: Vehicles electromechanics and Telecommunications facilities (IES San Jose), Administrative Management (IES Carmen Laffon), Aesthetic (IES Miguel de Mañara) and Welding and Boilers (IES Antonio Ulloa), to complete their training in a professional environment and increase their chances of integration in the labor market. 
The internships will contemplate two modalities:
- Practices for second year students who perform their FCT compulsory internship abroad, concluding the program with the acquisition of their title.
- Practices for young graduates, who will make their experience as an extracurricular training

25 participants will be involved, aged between 18 and 25 years without previous work experience (in the majority of the cases),  and selected through a public and common process between centers.
The training periods last 8 or 12 weeks, doing internships in companies in Italy, United Kingdom and Portugal.

The results and expected impact of participants will be clear: 
To complement their academic education with an internship 
To have their first work experience
To increase their language skills
To acquire a profile of versatile skills
To learn to use new technologies and work tools
To develop their transversal skills (autonomy, maturity, observation, reflection and adaptation)
To get a formal recognition of competences acquired through the Europass mobility document 
To get to know new cultures and social habits
To promote their interest in lifelong learning 
To increase their chances of recruitment once they have completed traineeship

Regarding the members of the consortium, the results are: 
To offer young people of La Rinconada (Spain) attractive possibilities to complete their training
To develop programs that encourage new recruitment opportunities
To reduce the unemployment rate in the municipality
To enhance local, regional, national and international economic development
To create a local network working
To create an international network
To acquire new working methods and technologies used in companies.
The project maintains a line of work initiated in the previous edition of the project, and the prospect is to make it sustainable over time. Once the consortium is created and work in concert, and once the project is known among the student population increasing its demand, the expected aim is to be able to increase the number of mobilities each year and involve other target group, like the staff schools. 

Also it’s expected to strengthen the network and cooperation, both locally and internationally, to exchange new ideas and new projects.
